archetypes.name: Path of the Storm Herald
archetypes.previewtext: Transform your rage in to a mantel of primal magic.

3.featuretextwithbullet: Storm of Fury - While raging, you emanate an aura in a 10-foot radius. The effects of this aura depend on your chosen environment.

entries.name: Desert
entries.previewtext: An origin who's features include: Constant area effect fire damage, resistance to fire damage and heat, and the ability to stop enemies in their tracks.

entries.name: Sea
entries.previewtext: An origin who's features include: Constant single target damage, underwater breathing, lightning resistance, and the ability to knock every enemy you strike to the ground.

entries.name: Tundra
entries.previewtext: An origin who's features include: Constant area effect cold damage, resistance to cold damage and environments, and a slowing effect on all nearby foes.

Sea - At the end of each of your turns, you can choose a creature in your aura, other than yourself. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to (8 + Proficiency bonus + Con Mod)

then.featuretext: The target takes 2d6 lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

then.featuretextwithbullet: Storm Soul: Desert - You gain resistance to fire damage and don’t suffer the effects of extreme heat.
Storm Soul: Sea - You gain resistance to lightning damage and can breathe underwater.
Storm Soul: Tundra - You gain resistance to cold damage and don’t suffer the effects of extreme cold.

10.featuretextwithbullet: Shield of the Storm - Your allies gain the benefit of your Storm Soul buff

combinestrings: Raging Storm: Desert - Any enemy that attempts to move more than 5 feet per turn on the ground while in your aura must make a Strength saving throw, (DC 8 + Proficiency bonus + Con mod)
On a failed save, the creature’s speed drops to 0 until the start of its next turn.

then.featuretextwithbullet: Raging Storm: Tundra - The area in your aura is difficult terrain for your enemies.
Raging Storm: Sea - Any creature in your aura that you hit with an attack must make a Strength saving throw (DC8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked prone.
